adjective.description: Remaining the same in all cases and at all times; unchanging in form or character.
examples: blocks of stone of uniform size
the decline in fertility was not uniform across social classes

adjective.description: Denoting a garment forming part of a person's uniform.

noun.description: The distinctive clothing worn by members of the same organization or body or by children attending certain schools.
examples: airline pilots in dark blue uniforms

noun.description: A code word representing the letter U, used in radio communication.

origin: Mid 16th century (as an adjective): from French uniforme or Latin uniformis (see uni-, form). Sense 1 of the noun dates from the mid 18th century.
